question: Which one of the following monohybrid crosses can be a test cross?
options: Rr X Rr
RR X Rr
RR X rr
RR X RR

question: Which of the following is different from the rest with regard to conservation of vegetation?
options: Using local practices for conservation
Replanting of land with endemic species
Replanting indigenous tree species
Large scale introduction of exotic plants

question: In the nervous co-ordination system, which of the following statements explains the synapse? It is a
options: chemical that transmits nerve impulses across the nervous system.
part of the skull that encloses brain for the purpose of protection.
junction between two neurons or a neuron and a muscle.
short term change in the electrical potential on the surface of cells.

question: Two students want to demonstrate a simple spinal reflex action using the knee jerk reflex. One of them sits down with one leg loosely crossed over the other. The other hits the crossed leg just below the knee cap gently but firmly using the edge of his hand. Which one of the following situations will happen during this demonstration?
options: impulse travels to the brain.
hit ligament stretches the muscle.
lower leg to jerk downwards and inwards.
impulse travels to quadriceps muscle from the brain.

question: Which one of the following eye structures is correctly matched with its function?
options: Pupil - serves as the eye's protective outer layer
Iris - controls the amount of light entering the eye
Cornea - provides nutrition to the retina
Choroid - bends the light into the eye

question: Which one of the following descriptions of proteins is correctly matched with its function in a cell membrane? Options: Peripheral protein - anchor integral proteins to the cytoskeleton, Glycoprotein-reduces the fluidity of the membrane, Channel proteins - larger molecules can pass through them, Carrier proteins - specific ions can pass along them
options: Peripheral protein - anchor integral proteins to the cytoskeleton
Glycoprotein- reduces the fluidity of the membrane
Channel proteins - larger molecules can pass through them
Carrier proteins - specific ions can pass along them

question: In the aerobic cellular respiration Options: Krebs cycle takes place in the cytoplasm., glycolysis takes place in the mitochondria., electron transport chain takes place in the cytoplasm., pyruvate enters into the mitochondria for further stages.
options: Krebs cycle takes place in the cytoplasm.
glycolysis takes place in the mitochondria.
electron transport chain takes place in the cytoplasm.
pyruvate enters into the mitochondria for further stages.

question: Suppose a hypothetical cell of 15% solute concentration is put in a beaker containing 90% water and 10% solute. In which way will the water move? Options: From the cell to the beaker, From the beaker to the cell, Both into and out of the cell, Both into and out of the beaker
options: From the cell to the beaker
From the beaker to the cell
Both into and out of the cell
Both into and out of the beaker

question: Which one of the following is correct about transport of substances across the cell membrane? Options: Simple diffusion - large particles transported through channel proteins, Facilitated diffusion - particles move from high water potential to lower one, Passive transport particles require energy in the form of ATP to derive the transport, Active transport - particles move from low to higher concentration using carrier prote
options: Simple diffusion - large particles transported through channel proteins
Facilitated diffusion - particles move from high water potential to lower one
Passive transport particles require energy in the form of ATP to derive the transport
Active transport - particles move from low to higher concentration using carrier proteins

question: Which one of the following processes of aerobic respiration takes place in the Krebs cycle Options: Hydrogen atoms carried by reduced NAD and FAD are released and split into protons and electrons., Two molecules of ATP are used to phosphorylate each molecules of glucose., Two carbon group from acetyl coenzyme A reacts with a 4-carbon compound to form citrate., Fructose 1, 6-bisphosphate is split into two molecules of the three-carbon sugar GP.
options: Hydrogen atoms carried by reduced NAD and FAD are released and split into protons and electrons.
Two molecules of ATP are used to phosphorylate each molecules of glucose.
Two carbon group from acetyl coenzyme A reacts with a 4-carbon compound to form citrate.
Fructose 1, 6-bisphosphate is split into two molecules of the three-carbon sugar GP.

question: Sickle cell anemia is caused by the replacement of glutamic acid by valine at a specific position in the beta chains of hemoglobin. This change is an example of which mutation?
options: Addition
Substitution
Inversion
Deletion

question: Stanley Miller conducted spark-discharge experiment by taking a mixture of gases that he thought to represent the primitive atmosphere of the Earth. All of the following were found in his gas mixture EXCEPT
options: NH3
CH4
H2
CO2

question: Which one of the following sentences explains the Darwin theory of evolution?
options: Environment changes creating a need for organism to change.
There is a natural variation in features that are heritable.
New features acquired in lifetime are passed to the offspring.
There is development of new feature in order to survive.

question: Comparative anatomy provides evidence of evolution because it
options: looks at structural similarities of organisms.
has remains of animals and plants from the remote past.
has an impression of animal even if the actual parts are missing.
studies the development of the embryos of vertebrates.

question: About 3 million years ago the Isthmus of Panama separated the shrimp population of the Caribbean Sea and created two populations of shrimps, one on either side of the Isthmus. They still look remarkably similar, but they do not interbreed with each other. Which type of isolation is described by this scenario?
options: Seasonal isolation
Geographical isolation
Behavioural isolation
Temporal isolation

question: Which one of the following sentences is true about viruses?
options: AIDS is caused by a DNA virus.
Corona virus is a DNA virus.
Swine flu is caused by an RNA virus.
Herpes simplex is a DNA virus.

question: The following steps are involved when HIV infects its host cell in the human body.
options: Conversion of viral RNA into DNA and its incorporation into cell's DNA.
Viral DNA's transcription into viral RNA and production of proteins.
Assemblage of new viral particles from RNA, proteins and Reverse Transcriptase
The binding of gp120 of HIV to CD4 of a T-Lymphocyte

question: Which one of the following bacteria produces ammonium ion by forming a symbiotic association with peas and beans?
options: Klebsiella
Azotobacter
Psuedomonas
Rhizobium

question: Which one of the following comparisons is true about primary and secondary successions? Secondary succession has
options: reduced species diversity.
reduced total biomass of the community.
has slower progress to reach to the climax.
more stable community.

question: Which one of the following processes takes place when lactate is produced?
options: NAD and FAD are regenerated from reduced NAD and FAD.
ATP is produced through oxidative phosphorylation.
Protons accumulation created in the inter-membrane space.
Reduced NAD supplies hydrogen and becomes oxidized itself.

question: Which one of the following structures of the photosystem is correctly related with its function?
units: Grade 10: Food Making and Growth in Plants
options: Chlorophyll a - a reaction center molecule
Antenna complex -light dependent reaction begins
Carotenoid - provides the hydrogen ions
Thylakoid - absorbs blue and red pigments

question: What happens during the electron transport system of respiration?
units: Grade 10: Food Making and Growth in Plants
options: four-carbon compound undergoes molecular transformation to generate oxaloacetate.
hydrogen atoms carried by FADH and NADH are released and split into protons and electrons.
citrate losses a carbon atom to form a five-carbon atom compound and CO2.
five carbon compound is further decarboxylated to form a four-carbon compound.

question: In a dihybrid self-crossing of a plant with genotype DdCc, 3600 offspring were produced. How many of the offspring will have the ddcc genotype?
During light-independent reactions of photosynthesis, glucose is synthesized through
units: Grade 10: Food Making and Growth in Plants
options: synthesis of reduced NADP that provides hydrogen ion.
six turns of the Calvin cycle to make one molecule of glucose.
release of hydrogen ions at the electron transport chain.
transmission of electrons to the inside of the thylakoid.

question: Which one of the following factors of photosynthesis is correctly matched with its effect?
units: Grade 10: Food Making and Growth in Plants
options: CO2 concentration - limits the reactions by influencing rate of initial reaction with RuBP
Low temperature - limits the rate of reactions by reducing the number of electrons in the chlorophyll
Low Rubisco - limits the number of reactions in the light dependent reaction
Light intensity - limits the rate of ATP synthase enzyme action in light dependent reactions.

question: Identify the correct statement regarding translation in eukaryotic cells.
options: helicase enzyme begins to unwind a section of DNA.
polymerase assembles free RNA nucleotides into a chain.
first two codons of the mRNA enter the ribosome.
RNA polymerase moves along the antisense strand.

question: Which of the following sentences explains how crossing over brings variation?
options: In meiosis I, there is splitting up of pairs of homologous chromosomes now and line up.
In meiosis I, there is exchange of a section of DNA between chromatids.
In meiosis II, homologous chromosomes align themselves independent of other pairs.
In meiosis II, chromatids from each chromosome are separated at random.

question: Which one of the following is an example of a learned behaviour?
options: Nest-building
Knee-jerk reflex
Weaving a web
Classical conditioning

question: What is the central role of tRNA in translation?
options: Carrying genetic information from DNA in the nucleus to ribosomes
Recognizing the codon of mRNA and bring the correct amino acid to the ribosomes
Acting as a template for converting a genetic code into amino acid sequence
Assembling the amino acid into a polypeptide chain

question: In a metabolic pathway, the end-product inhibition occurs when the
options: last product of the pathway inhibits the last enzymatic reaction.
first product of the pathway inhibits the last enzymatic reaction.
first product of the pathway inhibits the third enzyme of the reaction
last product of the pathway inhibits the first enzymatic reaction.

question: A student measured the diameter of onion epidermal cells at a magnification of 100X using a field of view adjusted to 2mm by stage micrometer. What would be the diameter of individual cells if 8 cells fit into the field of view of the microscope at 100X magnification?
options: 250μm
200μm
150μm
300μm

question: Which one of the following statements is correct about the description of the cell theory?
options: Schleiden and Schwann stated that all cells come from pre-existing cells.
Virchow stated that cell is the unit of structure, physiology and organization of living things.
Modern cell theory states that cells contain hereditary information that passes from cell to cell.
Spontaneous generation theory states that all cells have basically different chemical composition.

question: Which of the following characteristics of cells is found only in prokaryotic cell?
options: Division of labor within the cell
Continuous loop of DNA
10-100 µm long
Higher level of complexity

question: All of the following are examples of innate behaviours EXCEPT
options: training killer whales at marine parks.
increasing breathing rate during exercise.
producing tears when dust gets into the eyes.
a fly moving its maggot into more humid environment.

question: In the course of evolution, which of the following is true about the human brain?
options: Modern humans have a brain size between 0.7% and 1.0% of their body mass.
Australopithecus have a brain size between 1.8% and 2.3% of their body mass.
The pre-humans brain uses 80% of the resting energy requirement.
Homo sapiens brain uses 25% of the resting energy requirement.

question: Which one of the following stages of cell division is correctly described in meiosis II?
options: Prophase II - pairs of homologous chromosomes split up
Anaphase II - chromatids from each chromosome separate
Metaphase II - chromosomes pair and exchange segments
Telophase II - two haploid cells are produced

question: Which one of the following events is an example of a sex influenced trait?
options: Pattern baldness
Lactation
Ritinitis pigmentosa
Undescended testicles

question: In the CAM photosynthetic pathway,
units: Grade 10: Food Making and Growth in Plants
options: malate is stored in the mesophyll cells during the day.
glucose is synthesized in the bundle sheath cell during night.
ATP and NADPH are produced during the night.
the C4 stage and the Calvin cycle are separated in time.

question: In Gram staining, if some bacteria retain the crystal violet after counter staining, then the bacteria is
options: Gram positive.
Gram negative.
Gram intermediate.
Gram variable.

question: Which one of the following sentences explains the mechanism of bacterium to produce disease?
options: Its hyphae secrets enzymes which digest substances in the tissue.
It enters into the living cells and disrupts the metabolic systems.
It attaches with white blood cells and destroy the immune system.
Its genetic material is incorporated into the cell for instruction.

question: Which one of the following sentences explains the role of bacteria in genetic engineering? They are used to
options: isolate genes from donor DNA.
open up a plasmid.
cut genes from donor DNA.
contain a recombinant plasmid.

question: Which one of the following sentences describes a virus? It
options: has differentiated organelles.
is saprophytic.
is acellular.
undergoes respiration.

question: One of the following renowned Ethiopian biologists developed vaccine for the rinderpest disease
options: Professor Sebsebe Demissew
Professor Yalemtsehay Mekonnen
Professor Beyene Petros
Professor Tilahun Yilma

question: A grade nine student has planned to study animal cells using a compound light microscope... She prepared a slide of stained human cheek cells for this purpose. Which one of the following activities should she first do?
options: Adjust the iris diaphragm until the maximum brightness is coming.
Set up the microscope with the lowest power objective in place.
Using coarse focusing knob to rotate the nosepiece for a higher magnification lens.
Looking through the eyepiece lens to move the objectives down.

question: Which one of the following is true about plant cells? They have
units: Grade 10: Food Making and Growth in Plants
options: vacuole which controls all activities of the cell.
lysosomes which contain hydrolytic enzymes.
chloroplast which is filled with sap, liquids and minerals.
cell wall which gives support and strengthen to the cell.

question: A plant cell is placed in a solution which has lower solute concentration than its contents. After a few minutes the cell will become
options: turgid.
flaccid.
plasmolysed.
burst.

question: Which one of the following is correct about human food digestion?
options: The stomach physically breaks down the ingested food.
Mouth use protease enzyme to breakdown proteins.
Large intestine is the site of lipid hydrolysis.
The small intestine is site of absorption of digested molecules.

question: Which one of the following is NOT the function of the liver?
options: Controlling cholesterol
Storing glycogen
Monosaccharide metabolism
Bile formation

question: Which one of the following leaf structures is correctly matched with its function?
units: Grade 10: Food Making and Growth in Plants
options: Palisade mesophyll - the main photosynthetic tissue of the leaf
Waxy cuticle - controls the entry of carbon dioxide into the leaf
Guard cells - have lots of air space and gas exchange area of the leaf
Spongy mesophyll - helps to prevent water loss from the leaf

question: What will happen if an agriculture extension worker injects gibberellins into a dwarf plant?
units: Grade 10: Food Making and Growth in Plants
options: leaves will fall.
stem will grow.
roots will elongate.
side shoots will grow fast.

question: Suppose your friend fails suddenly due to heart attack and victim needs an artificial breathing to keep alive until medical support arrives. Which activity is strictly prohibited in this situation?
options: Remove any obstacle from the mouth that might block the airway
Open the airway by removing any obstacles from the mouth
Make sure the airway is open and the head is tilted back
Give mouth - to - mouth resuscitation if he is conscious

question: A biologist collected two types of seeds (SA and SB) from the field and sowed them in moist soils enriched with nutrients then he recorded his observations as follows:
units: Grade 10: Food Making and Growth  in Plants
options: SA
The seedling of this seed emerged from the soil curved while pushing up through the soil.
The hypocotyl straightened and carried the cotyledons and plumule above the soil surface.
SB

question: Which one of the following enzymes is correctly matched to the food stuffs it acts on?
options: Pepsin - protein
Maltase - lipids
Amylase - fats
Trypsin - starch

question: Which one of the following structures of the heart is correctly matched with its function?
options: Right atrium-contracts and forces deoxygenated blood into the lungs
Left ventricle - contracts and forces oxygenated blood around the body
Right ventricle - contracts and forces blood into the left ventricles
Left atrium - contracts and forces blood into the right ventricles

question: Which one of the following phyla is characterized by a flexible cartilaginous rod-like structure, that runs along the dorsal side of the body?
options: Phylum Mollusca
Phylum Chordata
Phylum Annelida
Phylum Arthropoda

question: Which one of the following sentences explains the traditional use of biotechnology? Production of
options: insulin using transgenic bacteria
dairy products at household level
myco-proteins under a laboratory
vinegar using industrial fermenter

question: Which one of the following sentences is correct about mitosis? It
options: is the division of sex cells resulting in identical daughter cells.
produces four different daughter cells from a single cell.
is the division of somatic cells to make identical daughter cells.
produces half number of chromosomes from the original cell.

question: A cross between pea plants having heterozygous genotype (Rr) has been made. Which of the following is correct about the offspring according to the Mendelian inheritance? The genotypic probability of getting
options: Rr is 25%.
Rr is 75%.
RR is 50%.
rr is 25%.

question: In the systematic naming of enzymes, assume an enzyme is designated as EC 3.4.11.1. Which of the following correctly describes this enzyme?
options: 11 - gives a sub-subclass to which the enzyme belongs.
1 - a reference of Enzyme Commission.
4 - shows to which main class the enzyme belongs.
3- indicates a subclass to which the enzyme belongs.

question: How does a competitive inhibitor affect an enzyme catalyzed reaction? By
options: denaturing the active site of the enzyme
producing conformational change of the enzyme
binding to the allosteric site of the enzyme
blocking the active site of the enzyme

question: Which one of the following groups of organisms is correctly matched with its phylum?
options: Starfish-Phylum Echinodermata
Fish- Phylum Arthropoda
Snail - Phylum Annelida
Earthworm - Phylum Mollusca

question: A zoologist studied 5 vertebrate species (spA, spB, spC, spD & spE) and described their features as follows.
options: spA: Smooth moist skin; pass parts of their lives in water and on land
spB: Streamlined bodies with scales; gills for gaseous exchange
spC: Feathers over the body and scales on legs; endothermic; horny beak
spD: Dry skin with scales; ectothermic; lungs for respiration

question: Which one of the following events happens during the carbon cycle? Carbon dioxide is
options: transferred from plants to animals by their feeding relationship.
absorbed from air when microbes decompose plants and animals.
removed from the air by animals during respiration.
returned into the air by plants during photosynthesis.

question: Which of the following plant adaptation mechanisms helps cactus to adapt in the desert environment?
units: Grade 10: Food Making and Growth in Plants
options: Spreading its seeds in wider areas
Increasing number of stomata in its leaves
Having broad leaves
Storing water in its tissue

question: A student has conducted an experiment using different enzymes to assess the enhancement of reaction rates under different conditions. She represents her results as indicated in the following table. Options: Enzymes used, Cofactors used, Rate enhancements, Optimum temperature required °C
topic: Experimental Design and Data Representation with Enzymes
options: Enzymes used
Cofactors used
Rate enhancements
Optimum temperature required °C

question: 7 x 108 Options: 30, Which one of the following is an acceptable conclusion of the experiment?, Enzyme 'X' could have enhanced the rate better at temperature slightly higher than 37°C., Enzyme 'M' cannot enhance the rate of reaction further if the temperature exceeds 30°C.
options: Which one of the following is an acceptable conclusion of the experiment?
Enzyme 'X' could have enhanced the rate better at temperature slightly higher than 37°C.
Enzyme 'M' cannot enhance the rate of reaction further if the temperature exceeds 30°C.

question: Which one of the following sentences correctly describes the properties of water? It Options: contracts when it freezes and ice acts as an insulator., takes low energy to change into vapor., allows all light wavelengths to pass through its various depths., requires high amount of energy to heat up.
units: Grade 10: Food Making and Growth in Plants
options: contracts when it freezes and ice acts as an insulator.
takes low energy to change into vapor.
allows all light wavelengths to pass through its various depths.
requires high amount of energy to heat up.

question: An organic molecule which is an important part of structure of chromosome is Options: amino acid., glycogen., amylose., triglyceride.
options: amino acid.
glycogen.
amylose.
triglyceride.

question: In animal cells, glycogen is hydrolysized quickly to release glucose for respiration. This is due to the presence of several Options: microfibrils in its side chain., α-1,6-glycosidic bonds., β-1,4-glycosidic bonds., enzymes that hydrolyse it easily.
units: Grade 10: Food Making and Growth in Plants
options: microfibrils in its side chain.
α-1,6-glycosidic bonds.
β-1,4-glycosidic bonds.
enzymes that hydrolyse it easily.

question: What is the function of dermis of the skin?
options: acts as protection against heat loss.
protects the entry of pathogens into the body.
forms a waterproof around the body tissue.
contains blood vessels and sweat glands.

question: ...dizzy. Why?
options: The otoliths round in the same direction with the head.
The optic nerves reports that the children are still moving.
The fluid in their semicircular canals keeps on moving after they stop.
The sensory hairs vibrate highly in response to movement of their body.

question: ... When does menstruation start in women with no obvious reproductive a health problem? It happens when...
options: the fertilized ovum reaches the uterus and attaches into the thick, spongy lining.
the FSH stimulates the development of a follicle in the ovary and the egg ripens.
pregnancy occurs and the embryo obtains nourishment and oxygen.
thick spongy lining of the uterus detaches in the absence of pregnancy.

question: ...Which one of the following sentences is correctly matched with the function of kidney structures?
options: Bowman's capsule - acts as a filter to produce urine
Cortex- monitors the osmotic pressure of the blood
Glomerulus concentrates urine and conserves water
Loop of Henle - involved in ultrafiltration

question: Which one of the following temperature controlling mechanisms in homoiotherms is categorized into behavioral method?
options: Sweating when the temperature increases
Constriction of capillaries when the temperature falls
Shivering as a result of drop in temperature
Seeking shade when the temperature rises

question: Which one of the following sentences is correct about the activities of the heart?
options: The noise of heartbeat one hears through a stethoscope is the sound of valves.
As the heart beats blood travels through the arteries with a uniform pressure.
Diastole is when the heart muscles contract and force the blood out.
Systole is when the heart muscles relax and it fills with blood.

question: During culturing micro-organisms, all of the following activities are important, EXCEPT
options: tilting the lid of the Petri dish during inoculation.
adding distilled water to a sterilized agar.
sterilizing the inoculating loops.
transferring target micro-organisms into an agar medium.

question: Which one of the following diseases can be caused by more than one type of microorganisms?
options: Cholera
Gastroenteritis
Typhoid
Tuberculosis

question: Which one of the following diseases is correctly explained with its causes or symptoms?
options: Syphilis is caused by Neisseria gonorrhoeae.
Gonorrhoea has a burning sensation symptom while urinating.
Gonorrhoea is caused by Treponema pallidum.
Syphilis has sore ulceration on the genitals as a symptom.

question: The names of which two taxa are used in binomial nomenclature?
options: The two lowest units of classification
The two middle units of classification
The highest and the lowest unit of classification
The two highest units of classification

question: Which of the following is an Ethiopian endemic plant?
options: Noug seed
Avocado
Bahir zaf
Bunna

question: Walia ibex is an endemic animal species in Ethiopia which is found in
options: Nechisar National Park.
Omo National Park.
Bale Mountain National Park.
Simien Mountain National Park.

question: All of the following sentences are correct about pollution EXCEPT
options: deforestation increases the amount of CO₂ absorbed from the atmosphere.
decomposition of dead bodies increases the amount of CO₂ in the atmosphere.
burning fossil fuels increases pollution due to the release of hydrocarbons.
burning of wood increases pollution by causing global dimming which blocks sunlight.

question: When a biologist shares her research findings with other fellow biologists, she is
options: making her hypothesis.
reporting her result.
drawing her conclusion.
analyzing her data.
